00030 /*
00031  *  To build applications for older versions of DirectInput
00032  *
00033  *  #define DIRECTINPUT_VERSION [ 0x0300 | 0x0500 | 0x0700 ]
00034  *
00035  *  before #include <dinput.h>.  By default, #include <dinput.h>
00036  *  will produce a DirectX 8-compatible header file.
00037  *
00038  */
00039 
00040 #define DIRECTINPUT_HEADER_VERSION  0x0800
00041 #ifndef DIRECTINPUT_VERSION
00042 #define DIRECTINPUT_VERSION         DIRECTINPUT_HEADER_VERSION
00043 #pragma message(__FILE__ ": DIRECTINPUT_VERSION undefined. Defaulting to version 0x0800")
00044 #endif
00045 
00046 #ifndef DIJ_RINGZERO

00224 typedef struct DIEFFECT_DX5 {
00225     DWORD dwSize;                   /* sizeof(DIEFFECT_DX5) */
00226     DWORD dwFlags;                  /* DIEFF_*              */
00227     DWORD dwDuration;               /* Microseconds         */
00228     DWORD dwSamplePeriod;           /* Microseconds         */
00229     DWORD dwGain;
00230     DWORD dwTriggerButton;          /* or DIEB_NOTRIGGER    */
00231     DWORD dwTriggerRepeatInterval;  /* Microseconds         */
00232     DWORD cAxes;                    /* Number of axes       */
00233     LPDWORD rgdwAxes;               /* Array of axes        */
00234     LPLONG rglDirection;            /* Array of directions  */
00235     LPDIENVELOPE lpEnvelope;        /* Optional             */
00236     DWORD cbTypeSpecificParams;     /* Size of params       */
00237     LPVOID lpvTypeSpecificParams;   /* Pointer to params    */
00238 } DIEFFECT_DX5, *LPDIEFFECT_DX5;

00325 {
00326     /*** IUnknown methods ***/

00328     STDMETHOD_(ULONG,AddRef)(THIS) PURE;
00329     STDMETHOD_(ULONG,Release)(THIS) PURE;
00330 
00331     /*** IDirectInputEffect methods ***/
00332     STDMETHOD(Initialize)(THIS_ HINSTANCE,DWORD,REFGUID) PURE;
00333     STDMETHOD(GetEffectGuid)(THIS_ LPGUID) PURE;
00334     STDMETHOD(GetParameters)(THIS_ LPDIEFFECT,DWORD) PURE;
00335     STDMETHOD(SetParameters)(THIS_ LPCDIEFFECT,DWORD) PURE;
00336     STDMETHOD(Start)(THIS_ DWORD,DWORD) PURE;
00337     STDMETHOD(Stop)(THIS) PURE;
00338     STDMETHOD(GetEffectStatus)(THIS_ LPDWORD) PURE;
00339     STDMETHOD(Download)(THIS) PURE;
00340     STDMETHOD(Unload)(THIS) PURE;
00341     STDMETHOD(Escape)(THIS_ LPDIEFFESCAPE) PURE;
00342 };

01986 
01987 typedef struct _DIMOUSESTATE {
01988     LONG    lX;
01989     LONG    lY;
01990     LONG    lZ;
01991     BYTE    rgbButtons[4];
01992 } DIMOUSESTATE, *LPDIMOUSESTATE;
01993 
01994 #if DIRECTINPUT_VERSION >= 0x0700
01995 typedef struct _DIMOUSESTATE2 {
01996     LONG    lX;
01997     LONG    lY;
01998     LONG    lZ;
01999     BYTE    rgbButtons[8];
02000 } DIMOUSESTATE2, *LPDIMOUSESTATE2;
02001 #endif
02002 
02003 
02004 #define DIMOFS_X        FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE, lX)
02005 #define DIMOFS_Y        FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE, lY)
02006 #define DIMOFS_Z        FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE, lZ)
02007 #define DIMOFS_BUTTON0 (FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE, rgbButtons) + 0)
02008 #define DIMOFS_BUTTON1 (FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE, rgbButtons) + 1)
02009 #define DIMOFS_BUTTON2 (FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE, rgbButtons) + 2)
02010 #define DIMOFS_BUTTON3 (FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE, rgbButtons) + 3)
02011 #if (DIRECTINPUT_VERSION >= 0x0700)
02012 #define DIMOFS_BUTTON4 (FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE2, rgbButtons) + 4)
02013 #define DIMOFS_BUTTON5 (FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE2, rgbButtons) + 5)
02014 #define DIMOFS_BUTTON6 (FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE2, rgbButtons) + 6)
02015 #define DIMOFS_BUTTON7 (FIELD_OFFSET(DIMOUSESTATE2, rgbButtons) + 7)
02016 #endif

02019 /****************************************************************************
02020  *
02021  *      Keyboard
02022  *
02023  ****************************************************************************/
02024 
02025 #ifndef DIJ_RINGZERO
02026 
02027 /****************************************************************************
02028  *
02029  *      DirectInput keyboard scan codes
02030  *
02031  ****************************************************************************/
02032 #define DIK_ESCAPE          0x01
02033 #define DIK_1               0x02
02034 #define DIK_2               0x03
02035 #define DIK_3               0x04
02036 #define DIK_4               0x05
02037 #define DIK_5               0x06
02038 #define DIK_6               0x07
02039 #define DIK_7               0x08
02040 #define DIK_8               0x09
02041 #define DIK_9               0x0A
02042 #define DIK_0               0x0B
02043 #define DIK_MINUS           0x0C    /* - on main keyboard */
02044 #define DIK_EQUALS          0x0D
02045 #define DIK_BACK            0x0E    /* backspace */
02046 #define DIK_TAB             0x0F
02047 #define DIK_Q               0x10
02048 #define DIK_W               0x11
02049 #define DIK_E               0x12
02050 #define DIK_R               0x13
02051 #define DIK_T               0x14
02052 #define DIK_Y               0x15
02053 #define DIK_U               0x16
02054 #define DIK_I               0x17
02055 #define DIK_O               0x18
02056 #define DIK_P               0x19
02057 #define DIK_LBRACKET        0x1A
02058 #define DIK_RBRACKET        0x1B
02059 #define DIK_RETURN          0x1C    /* Enter on main keyboard */
02060 #define DIK_LCONTROL        0x1D
02061 #define DIK_A               0x1E
02062 #define DIK_S               0x1F
02063 #define DIK_D               0x20
02064 #define DIK_F               0x21
02065 #define DIK_G               0x22
02066 #define DIK_H               0x23
02067 #define DIK_J               0x24
02068 #define DIK_K               0x25
02069 #define DIK_L               0x26
02070 #define DIK_SEMICOLON       0x27
02071 #define DIK_APOSTROPHE      0x28
02072 #define DIK_GRAVE           0x29    /* accent grave */
02073 #define DIK_LSHIFT          0x2A
02074 #define DIK_BACKSLASH       0x2B
02075 #define DIK_Z               0x2C
02076 #define DIK_X               0x2D
02077 #define DIK_C               0x2E
02078 #define DIK_V               0x2F
02079 #define DIK_B               0x30
02080 #define DIK_N               0x31
02081 #define DIK_M               0x32
02082 #define DIK_COMMA           0x33
02083 #define DIK_PERIOD          0x34    /* . on main keyboard */
02084 #define DIK_SLASH           0x35    /* / on main keyboard */
02085 #define DIK_RSHIFT          0x36
02086 #define DIK_MULTIPLY        0x37    /* * on numeric keypad */
02087 #define DIK_LMENU           0x38    /* left Alt */
02088 #define DIK_SPACE           0x39
02089 #define DIK_CAPITAL         0x3A
02090 #define DIK_F1              0x3B
02091 #define DIK_F2              0x3C
02092 #define DIK_F3              0x3D
02093 #define DIK_F4              0x3E
02094 #define DIK_F5              0x3F
02095 #define DIK_F6              0x40
02096 #define DIK_F7              0x41
02097 #define DIK_F8              0x42
02098 #define DIK_F9              0x43
02099 #define DIK_F10             0x44
02100 #define DIK_NUMLOCK         0x45
02101 #define DIK_SCROLL          0x46    /* Scroll Lock */
02102 #define DIK_NUMPAD7         0x47
02103 #define DIK_NUMPAD8         0x48
02104 #define DIK_NUMPAD9         0x49
02105 #define DIK_SUBTRACT        0x4A    /* - on numeric keypad */
02106 #define DIK_NUMPAD4         0x4B
02107 #define DIK_NUMPAD5         0x4C
02108 #define DIK_NUMPAD6         0x4D
02109 #define DIK_ADD             0x4E    /* + on numeric keypad */
02110 #define DIK_NUMPAD1         0x4F
02111 #define DIK_NUMPAD2         0x50
02112 #define DIK_NUMPAD3         0x51
02113 #define DIK_NUMPAD0         0x52
02114 #define DIK_DECIMAL         0x53    /* . on numeric keypad */
02115 #define DIK_OEM_102         0x56    /* <> or \| on RT 102-key keyboard (Non-U.S.) */
02116 #define DIK_F11             0x57
02117 #define DIK_F12             0x58
02118 #define DIK_F13             0x64    /*                     (NEC PC98) */
02119 #define DIK_F14             0x65    /*                     (NEC PC98) */
02120 #define DIK_F15             0x66    /*                     (NEC PC98) */
02121 #define DIK_KANA            0x70    /* (Japanese keyboard)            */
02122 #define DIK_ABNT_C1         0x73    /* /? on Brazilian keyboard */
02123 #define DIK_CONVERT         0x79    /* (Japanese keyboard)            */
02124 #define DIK_NOCONVERT       0x7B    /* (Japanese keyboard)            */
02125 #define DIK_YEN             0x7D    /* (Japanese keyboard)            */
02126 #define DIK_ABNT_C2         0x7E    /* Numpad . on Brazilian keyboard */
02127 #define DIK_NUMPADEQUALS    0x8D    /* = on numeric keypad (NEC PC98) */
02128 #define DIK_PREVTRACK       0x90    /* Previous Track (DIK_CIRCUMFLEX on Japanese keyboard) */
02129 #define DIK_AT              0x91    /*                     (NEC PC98) */
02130 #define DIK_COLON           0x92    /*                     (NEC PC98) */
02131 #define DIK_UNDERLINE       0x93    /*                     (NEC PC98) */
02132 #define DIK_KANJI           0x94    /* (Japanese keyboard)            */
02133 #define DIK_STOP            0x95    /*                     (NEC PC98) */
02134 #define DIK_AX              0x96    /*                     (Japan AX) */
02135 #define DIK_UNLABELED       0x97    /*                        (J3100) */
02136 #define DIK_NEXTTRACK       0x99    /* Next Track */
02137 #define DIK_NUMPADENTER     0x9C    /* Enter on numeric keypad */
02138 #define DIK_RCONTROL        0x9D
02139 #define DIK_MUTE            0xA0    /* Mute */
02140 #define DIK_CALCULATOR      0xA1    /* Calculator */
02141 #define DIK_PLAYPAUSE       0xA2    /* Play / Pause */
02142 #define DIK_MEDIASTOP       0xA4    /* Media Stop */
02143 #define DIK_VOLUMEDOWN      0xAE    /* Volume - */
02144 #define DIK_VOLUMEUP        0xB0    /* Volume + */
02145 #define DIK_WEBHOME         0xB2    /* Web home */
02146 #define DIK_NUMPADCOMMA     0xB3    /* , on numeric keypad (NEC PC98) */
02147 #define DIK_DIVIDE          0xB5    /* / on numeric keypad */
02148 #define DIK_SYSRQ           0xB7
02149 #define DIK_RMENU           0xB8    /* right Alt */
02150 #define DIK_PAUSE           0xC5    /* Pause */
02151 #define DIK_HOME            0xC7    /* Home on arrow keypad */
02152 #define DIK_UP              0xC8    /* UpArrow on arrow keypad */
02153 #define DIK_PRIOR           0xC9    /* PgUp on arrow keypad */
02154 #define DIK_LEFT            0xCB    /* LeftArrow on arrow keypad */
02155 #define DIK_RIGHT           0xCD    /* RightArrow on arrow keypad */
02156 #define DIK_END             0xCF    /* End on arrow keypad */
02157 #define DIK_DOWN            0xD0    /* DownArrow on arrow keypad */
02158 #define DIK_NEXT            0xD1    /* PgDn on arrow keypad */
02159 #define DIK_INSERT          0xD2    /* Insert on arrow keypad */
02160 #define DIK_DELETE          0xD3    /* Delete on arrow keypad */
02161 #define DIK_LWIN            0xDB    /* Left Windows key */
02162 #define DIK_RWIN            0xDC    /* Right Windows key */
02163 #define DIK_APPS            0xDD    /* AppMenu key */
02164 #define DIK_POWER           0xDE    /* System Power */
02165 #define DIK_SLEEP           0xDF    /* System Sleep */
02166 #define DIK_WAKE            0xE3    /* System Wake */
02167 #define DIK_WEBSEARCH       0xE5    /* Web Search */
02168 #define DIK_WEBFAVORITES    0xE6    /* Web Favorites */
02169 #define DIK_WEBREFRESH      0xE7    /* Web Refresh */
02170 #define DIK_WEBSTOP         0xE8    /* Web Stop */
02171 #define DIK_WEBFORWARD      0xE9    /* Web Forward */
02172 #define DIK_WEBBACK         0xEA    /* Web Back */
02173 #define DIK_MYCOMPUTER      0xEB    /* My Computer */
02174 #define DIK_MAIL            0xEC    /* Mail */
02175 #define DIK_MEDIASELECT     0xED    /* Media Select */
02176 
02177 /*
02178  *  Alternate names for keys, to facilitate transition from DOS.
02179  */
02180 #define DIK_BACKSPACE       DIK_BACK            /* backspace */
02181 #define DIK_NUMPADSTAR      DIK_MULTIPLY        /* * on numeric keypad */
02182 #define DIK_LALT            DIK_LMENU           /* left Alt */
02183 #define DIK_CAPSLOCK        DIK_CAPITAL         /* CapsLock */
02184 #define DIK_NUMPADMINUS     DIK_SUBTRACT        /* - on numeric keypad */
02185 #define DIK_NUMPADPLUS      DIK_ADD             /* + on numeric keypad */
02186 #define DIK_NUMPADPERIOD    DIK_DECIMAL         /* . on numeric keypad */
02187 #define DIK_NUMPADSLASH     DIK_DIVIDE          /* / on numeric keypad */
02188 #define DIK_RALT            DIK_RMENU           /* right Alt */
02189 #define DIK_UPARROW         DIK_UP              /* UpArrow on arrow keypad */
02190 #define DIK_PGUP            DIK_PRIOR           /* PgUp on arrow keypad */
02191 #define DIK_LEFTARROW       DIK_LEFT            /* LeftArrow on arrow keypad */
02192 #define DIK_RIGHTARROW      DIK_RIGHT           /* RightArrow on arrow keypad */
02193 #define DIK_DOWNARROW       DIK_DOWN            /* DownArrow on arrow keypad */
02194 #define DIK_PGDN            DIK_NEXT            /* PgDn on arrow keypad */

02203 /****************************************************************************
02204  *
02205  *      Joystick
02206  *
02207  ****************************************************************************/
02208 
02209 #ifndef DIJ_RINGZERO
02210 
02211 typedef struct DIJOYSTATE {
02212     LONG    lX;                     /* x-axis position              */
02213     LONG    lY;                     /* y-axis position              */
02214     LONG    lZ;                     /* z-axis position              */
02215     LONG    lRx;                    /* x-axis rotation              */
02216     LONG    lRy;                    /* y-axis rotation              */
02217     LONG    lRz;                    /* z-axis rotation              */
02218     LONG    rglSlider[2];           /* extra axes positions         */
02219     DWORD   rgdwPOV[4];             /* POV directions               */
02220     BYTE    rgbButtons[32];         /* 32 buttons                   */
02221 } DIJOYSTATE, *LPDIJOYSTATE;
02222 
02223 typedef struct DIJOYSTATE2 {
02224     LONG    lX;                     /* x-axis position              */
02225     LONG    lY;                     /* y-axis position              */
02226     LONG    lZ;                     /* z-axis position              */
02227     LONG    lRx;                    /* x-axis rotation              */
02228     LONG    lRy;                    /* y-axis rotation              */
02229     LONG    lRz;                    /* z-axis rotation              */
02230     LONG    rglSlider[2];           /* extra axes positions         */
02231     DWORD   rgdwPOV[4];             /* POV directions               */
02232     BYTE    rgbButtons[128];        /* 128 buttons                  */
02233     LONG    lVX;                    /* x-axis velocity              */
02234     LONG    lVY;                    /* y-axis velocity              */
02235     LONG    lVZ;                    /* z-axis velocity              */
02236     LONG    lVRx;                   /* x-axis angular velocity      */
02237     LONG    lVRy;                   /* y-axis angular velocity      */
02238     LONG    lVRz;                   /* z-axis angular velocity      */
02239     LONG    rglVSlider[2];          /* extra axes velocities        */
02240     LONG    lAX;                    /* x-axis acceleration          */
02241     LONG    lAY;                    /* y-axis acceleration          */
02242     LONG    lAZ;                    /* z-axis acceleration          */
02243     LONG    lARx;                   /* x-axis angular acceleration  */
02244     LONG    lARy;                   /* y-axis angular acceleration  */
02245     LONG    lARz;                   /* z-axis angular acceleration  */
02246     LONG    rglASlider[2];          /* extra axes accelerations     */
02247     LONG    lFX;                    /* x-axis force                 */
02248     LONG    lFY;                    /* y-axis force                 */
02249     LONG    lFZ;                    /* z-axis force                 */
02250     LONG    lFRx;                   /* x-axis torque                */
02251     LONG    lFRy;                   /* y-axis torque                */
02252     LONG    lFRz;                   /* z-axis torque                */
02253     LONG    rglFSlider[2];          /* extra axes forces            */
02254 } DIJOYSTATE2, *LPDIJOYSTATE2;
02255 
02256 #define DIJOFS_X            FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, lX)
02257 #define DIJOFS_Y            FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, lY)
02258 #define DIJOFS_Z            FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, lZ)
02259 #define DIJOFS_RX           FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, lRx)
02260 #define DIJOFS_RY           FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, lRy)
02261 #define DIJOFS_RZ           FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, lRz)
02262 #define DIJOFS_SLIDER(n)   (FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, rglSlider) + \
02263                                                         (n) * sizeof(LONG))
02264 #define DIJOFS_POV(n)      (FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, rgdwPOV) + \
02265                                                         (n) * sizeof(DWORD))
02266 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON(n)   (FIELD_OFFSET(DIJOYSTATE, rgbButtons) + (n))
02267 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON0      DIJOFS_BUTTON(0)
02268 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON1      DIJOFS_BUTTON(1)
02269 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON2      DIJOFS_BUTTON(2)
02270 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON3      DIJOFS_BUTTON(3)
02271 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON4      DIJOFS_BUTTON(4)
02272 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON5      DIJOFS_BUTTON(5)
02273 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON6      DIJOFS_BUTTON(6)
02274 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON7      DIJOFS_BUTTON(7)
02275 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON8      DIJOFS_BUTTON(8)
02276 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON9      DIJOFS_BUTTON(9)
02277 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON10     DIJOFS_BUTTON(10)
02278 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON11     DIJOFS_BUTTON(11)
02279 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON12     DIJOFS_BUTTON(12)
02280 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON13     DIJOFS_BUTTON(13)
02281 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON14     DIJOFS_BUTTON(14)
02282 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON15     DIJOFS_BUTTON(15)
02283 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON16     DIJOFS_BUTTON(16)
02284 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON17     DIJOFS_BUTTON(17)
02285 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON18     DIJOFS_BUTTON(18)
02286 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON19     DIJOFS_BUTTON(19)
02287 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON20     DIJOFS_BUTTON(20)
02288 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON21     DIJOFS_BUTTON(21)
02289 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON22     DIJOFS_BUTTON(22)
02290 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON23     DIJOFS_BUTTON(23)
02291 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON24     DIJOFS_BUTTON(24)
02292 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON25     DIJOFS_BUTTON(25)
02293 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON26     DIJOFS_BUTTON(26)
02294 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON27     DIJOFS_BUTTON(27)
02295 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON28     DIJOFS_BUTTON(28)
02296 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON29     DIJOFS_BUTTON(29)
02297 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON30     DIJOFS_BUTTON(30)
02298 #define DIJOFS_BUTTON31     DIJOFS_BUTTON(31)
02299

02301 #endif /* DIJ_RINGZERO */

02702 
02703 /****************************************************************************
02704  *
02705  *  Return Codes
02706  *
02707  ****************************************************************************/
02708 
02709 /*
02710  *  The operation completed successfully.
02711  */
02712 #define DI_OK                           S_OK
02713 
02714 /*
02715  *  The device exists but is not currently attached.
02716  */
02717 #define DI_NOTATTACHED                  S_FALSE
02718 
02719 /*
02720  *  The device buffer overflowed.  Some input was lost.
02721  */
02722 #define DI_BUFFEROVERFLOW               S_FALSE
02723 
02724 /*
02725  *  The change in device properties had no effect.
02726  */
02727 #define DI_PROPNOEFFECT                 S_FALSE
02728 
02729 /*
02730  *  The operation had no effect.
02731  */
02732 #define DI_NOEFFECT                     S_FALSE
02733 
02734 /*
02735  *  The device is a polled device.  As a result, device buffering
02736  *  will not collect any data and event notifications will not be
02737  *  signalled until GetDeviceState is called.
02738  */
02739 #define DI_POLLEDDEVICE                 ((HRESULT)0x00000002L)
02740 
02741 /*
02742  *  The parameters of the effect were successfully updated by
02743  *  IDirectInputEffect::SetParameters, but the effect was not
02744  *  downloaded because the device is not exclusively acquired
02745  *  or because the DIEP_NODOWNLOAD flag was passed.
02746  */
02747 #define DI_DOWNLOADSKIPPED              ((HRESULT)0x00000003L)
02748 
02749 /*
02750  *  The parameters of the effect were successfully updated by
02751  *  IDirectInputEffect::SetParameters, but in order to change
02752  *  the parameters, the effect needed to be restarted.
02753  */
02754 #define DI_EFFECTRESTARTED              ((HRESULT)0x00000004L)
02755 
02756 /*
02757  *  The parameters of the effect were successfully updated by
02758  *  IDirectInputEffect::SetParameters, but some of them were
02759  *  beyond the capabilities of the device and were truncated.
02760  */
02761 #define DI_TRUNCATED                    ((HRESULT)0x00000008L)
02762 
02763 /*
02764  *  The settings have been successfully applied but could not be 
02765  *  persisted. 
02766  */
02767 #define DI_SETTINGSNOTSAVED                             ((HRESULT)0x0000000BL)
02768 
02769 /*
02770  *  Equal to DI_EFFECTRESTARTED | DI_TRUNCATED.
02771  */
02772 #define DI_TRUNCATEDANDRESTARTED        ((HRESULT)0x0000000CL)
02773 
02774 /*
02775  *  A SUCCESS code indicating that settings cannot be modified.
02776  */
02777 #define DI_WRITEPROTECT                 ((HRESULT)0x00000013L)
02778 
02779 /*
02780  *  The application requires a newer version of DirectInput.
02781  */
02782 #define DIERR_OLDDIRECTINPUTVERSION     \
02783     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_OLD_WIN_VERSION)
02784 
02785 /*
02786  *  The application was written for an unsupported prerelease version
02787  *  of DirectInput.
02788  */
02789 #define DIERR_BETADIRECTINPUTVERSION    \
02790     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_RMODE_APP)
02791 
02792 /*
02793  *  The object could not be created due to an incompatible driver version
02794  *  or mismatched or incomplete driver components.
02795  */
02796 #define DIERR_BADDRIVERVER              \
02797     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_BAD_DRIVER_LEVEL)
02798 
02799 /*
02800  * The device or device instance or effect is not registered with DirectInput.
02801  */
02802 #define DIERR_DEVICENOTREG              REGDB_E_CLASSNOTREG
02803 
02804 /*
02805  * The requested object does not exist.
02806  */
02807 #define DIERR_NOTFOUND                  \
02808     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND)
02809 
02810 /*
02811  * The requested object does not exist.
02812  */
02813 #define DIERR_OBJECTNOTFOUND            \
02814     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND)
02815 
02816 /*
02817  * An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function,
02818  * or the object was not in a state that admitted the function
02819  * to be called.
02820  */
02821 #define DIERR_INVALIDPARAM              E_INVALIDARG
02822 
02823 /*
02824  * The specified interface is not supported by the object
02825  */
02826 #define DIERR_NOINTERFACE               E_NOINTERFACE
02827 
02828 /*
02829  * An undetermined error occured inside the DInput subsystem
02830  */
02831 #define DIERR_GENERIC                   E_FAIL
02832 
02833 /*
02834  * The DInput subsystem couldn't allocate sufficient memory to complete the
02835  * caller's request.
02836  */
02837 #define DIERR_OUTOFMEMORY               E_OUTOFMEMORY
02838 
02839 /*
02840  * The function called is not supported at this time
02841  */
02842 #define DIERR_UNSUPPORTED               E_NOTIMPL
02843 
02844 /*
02845  * This object has not been initialized
02846  */
02847 #define DIERR_NOTINITIALIZED            \
02848     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_NOT_READY)
02849 
02850 /*
02851  * This object is already initialized
02852  */
02853 #define DIERR_ALREADYINITIALIZED        \
02854     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_ALREADY_INITIALIZED)
02855 
02856 /*
02857  * This object does not support aggregation
02858  */
02859 #define DIERR_NOAGGREGATION             CLASS_E_NOAGGREGATION
02860 
02861 /*
02862  * Another app has a higher priority level, preventing this call from
02863  * succeeding.
02864  */
02865 #define DIERR_OTHERAPPHASPRIO           E_ACCESSDENIED
02866 
02867 /*
02868  * Access to the device has been lost.  It must be re-acquired.
02869  */
02870 #define DIERR_INPUTLOST                 \
02871     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_READ_FAULT)
02872 
02873 /*
02874  * The operation cannot be performed while the device is acquired.
02875  */
02876 #define DIERR_ACQUIRED                  \
02877     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_BUSY)
02878 
02879 /*
02880  * The operation cannot be performed unless the device is acquired.
02881  */
02882 #define DIERR_NOTACQUIRED               \
02883     MAKE_HRESULT(SEVERITY_ERROR, FACILITY_WIN32, ERROR_INVALID_ACCESS)
02884 
02885 /*
02886  * The specified property cannot be changed.
02887  */
02888 #define DIERR_READONLY                  E_ACCESSDENIED
02889 
02890 /*
02891  * The device already has an event notification associated with it.
02892  */
02893 #define DIERR_HANDLEEXISTS              E_ACCESSDENIED
02894 
02895 /*
02896  * Data is not yet available.
02897  */
02898 #ifndef E_PENDING
02899 #define E_PENDING                       0x8000000AL
02900 #endif
02901 
02902 /*
02903  * Unable to IDirectInputJoyConfig_Acquire because the user
02904  * does not have sufficient privileges to change the joystick
02905  * configuration.
02906  */
02907 #define DIERR_INSUFFICIENTPRIVS         0x80040200L
02908 
02909 /*
02910  * The device is full.
02911  */
02912 #define DIERR_DEVICEFULL                0x80040201L
02913 
02914 /*
02915  * Not all the requested information fit into the buffer.
02916  */
02917 #define DIERR_MOREDATA                  0x80040202L
02918 
02919 /*
02920  * The effect is not downloaded.
02921  */
02922 #define DIERR_NOTDOWNLOADED             0x80040203L
02923 
02924 /*
02925  *  The device cannot be reinitialized because there are still effects
02926  *  attached to it.
02927  */
02928 #define DIERR_HASEFFECTS                0x80040204L
02929 
02930 /*
02931  *  The operation cannot be performed unless the device is acquired
02932  *  in DISCL_EXCLUSIVE mode.
02933  */
02934 #define DIERR_NOTEXCLUSIVEACQUIRED      0x80040205L
02935 
02936 /*
02937  *  The effect could not be downloaded because essential information
02938  *  is missing.  For example, no axes have been associated with the
02939  *  effect, or no type-specific information has been created.
02940  */
02941 #define DIERR_INCOMPLETEEFFECT          0x80040206L
02942 
02943 /*
02944  *  Attempted to read buffered device data from a device that is
02945  *  not buffered.
02946  */
02947 #define DIERR_NOTBUFFERED               0x80040207L
02948 
02949 /*
02950  *  An attempt was made to modify parameters of an effect while it is
02951  *  playing.  Not all hardware devices support altering the parameters
02952  *  of an effect while it is playing.
02953  */
02954 #define DIERR_EFFECTPLAYING             0x80040208L
02955 
02956 /*
02957  *  The operation could not be completed because the device is not
02958  *  plugged in.
02959  */
02960 #define DIERR_UNPLUGGED                 0x80040209L
02961 
02962 /*
02963  *  SendDeviceData failed because more information was requested
02964  *  to be sent than can be sent to the device.  Some devices have
02965  *  restrictions on how much data can be sent to them.  (For example,
02966  *  there might be a limit on the number of buttons that can be
02967  *  pressed at once.)
02968  */
02969 #define DIERR_REPORTFULL                0x8004020AL
02970 
02971 
02972 /*
02973  *  A mapper file function failed because reading or writing the user or IHV 
02974  *  settings file failed.
02975  */
02976 #define DIERR_MAPFILEFAIL               0x8004020BL
02977

04245 /*
04246  *  "ANY" semantics can be used as a last resort to get mappings for actions 
04247  *  that match nothing in the chosen virtual genre.  These semantics will be 
04248  *  mapped at a lower priority that virtual genre semantics.  Also, hardware 
04249  *  vendors will not be able to provide sensible mappings for these unless 
04250  *  they provide application specific mappings.
04251  */
04252 #define DIAXIS_ANY_X_1                          0xFF00C201 
04253 #define DIAXIS_ANY_X_2                          0xFF00C202 
04254 #define DIAXIS_ANY_Y_1                          0xFF014201 
04255 #define DIAXIS_ANY_Y_2                          0xFF014202 
04256 #define DIAXIS_ANY_Z_1                          0xFF01C201 
04257 #define DIAXIS_ANY_Z_2                          0xFF01C202 
04258 #define DIAXIS_ANY_R_1                          0xFF024201 
04259 #define DIAXIS_ANY_R_2                          0xFF024202 
04260 #define DIAXIS_ANY_U_1                          0xFF02C201 
04261 #define DIAXIS_ANY_U_2                          0xFF02C202 
04262 #define DIAXIS_ANY_V_1                          0xFF034201 
04263 #define DIAXIS_ANY_V_2                          0xFF034202 
04264 #define DIAXIS_ANY_A_1                          0xFF03C201 
04265 #define DIAXIS_ANY_A_2                          0xFF03C202 
04266 #define DIAXIS_ANY_B_1                          0xFF044201 
04267 #define DIAXIS_ANY_B_2                          0xFF044202 
04268 #define DIAXIS_ANY_C_1                          0xFF04C201 
04269 #define DIAXIS_ANY_C_2                          0xFF04C202 
04270 #define DIAXIS_ANY_S_1                          0xFF054201 
04271 #define DIAXIS_ANY_S_2                          0xFF054202 
04272 
04273 #define DIAXIS_ANY_1                            0xFF004201 
04274 #define DIAXIS_ANY_2                            0xFF004202 
04275 #define DIAXIS_ANY_3                            0xFF004203 
04276 #define DIAXIS_ANY_4                            0xFF004204 
04277 
04278 #define DIPOV_ANY_1                             0xFF004601 
04279 #define DIPOV_ANY_2                             0xFF004602 
04280 #define DIPOV_ANY_3                             0xFF004603 
04281 #define DIPOV_ANY_4                             0xFF004604 
04282 
04283 #define DIBUTTON_ANY(instance)                  ( 0xFF004400 | instance )
04284

04288 #endif

04290 #endif  /* __DINPUT_INCLUDED__ */

04292 /****************************************************************************
04293  *
04294  *  Definitions for non-IDirectInput (VJoyD) features defined more recently
04295  *  than the current sdk files
04296  *
04297  ****************************************************************************/
04298 
04299 #ifdef _INC_MMSYSTEM
04300 #ifndef MMNOJOY
04301 
04302 #ifndef __VJOYDX_INCLUDED__
04303 #define __VJOYDX_INCLUDED__
04304 
04305 #ifdef __cplusplus
04306 extern "C" {
04307 #endif
04308 
04309 /*
04310  * Flag to indicate that the dwReserved2 field of the JOYINFOEX structure
04311  * contains mini-driver specific data to be passed by VJoyD to the mini-
04312  * driver instead of doing a poll.
04313  */
04314 #define JOY_PASSDRIVERDATA          0x10000000l
04315 
04316 /*
04317  * Informs the joystick driver that the configuration has been changed
04318  * and should be reloaded from the registery.
04319  * dwFlags is reserved and should be set to zero
04320  */
04321 WINMMAPI MMRESULT WINAPI joyConfigChanged( DWORD dwFlags );
04322 
04323 #ifndef DIJ_RINGZERO
04324 /*
04325  * Invoke the joystick control panel directly, using the passed window handle 
04326  * as the parent of the dialog.  This API is only supported for compatibility 
04327  * purposes; new applications should use the RunControlPanel method of a 
04328  * device interface for a game controller.
04329  * The API is called by using the function pointer returned by
04330  * GetProcAddress( hCPL, TEXT("ShowJoyCPL") ) where hCPL is a HMODULE returned 
04331  * by LoadLibrary( TEXT("joy.cpl") ).  The typedef is provided to allow 
04332  * declaration and casting of an appropriately typed variable.
04333  */
04334 void WINAPI ShowJoyCPL( HWND hWnd );
04335 typedef void (WINAPI* LPFNSHOWJOYCPL)( HWND hWnd );
04336 #endif /* DIJ_RINGZERO */
04337 
04338 
04339 /*
04340  * Hardware Setting indicating that the device is a headtracker
04341  */
04342 #define JOY_HWS_ISHEADTRACKER       0x02000000l
04343 
04344 /*
04345  * Hardware Setting indicating that the VxD is used to replace
04346  * the standard analog polling
04347  */
04348 #define JOY_HWS_ISGAMEPORTDRIVER    0x04000000l
04349 
04350 /*
04351  * Hardware Setting indicating that the driver needs a standard
04352  * gameport in order to communicate with the device.
04353  */
04354 #define JOY_HWS_ISANALOGPORTDRIVER  0x08000000l
04355 
04356 /*
04357  * Hardware Setting indicating that VJoyD should not load this
04358  * driver, it will be loaded externally and will register with
04359  * VJoyD of it's own accord.
04360  */
04361 #define JOY_HWS_AUTOLOAD            0x10000000l
04362 
04363 /*
04364  * Hardware Setting indicating that the driver acquires any
04365  * resources needed without needing a devnode through VJoyD.
04366  */
04367 #define JOY_HWS_NODEVNODE           0x20000000l
04368 
04369 
04370 /*
04371  * Hardware Setting indicating that the device is a gameport bus
04372  */
04373 #define JOY_HWS_ISGAMEPORTBUS       0x80000000l
04374 #define JOY_HWS_GAMEPORTBUSBUSY     0x00000001l
04375 
04376 /*
04377  * Usage Setting indicating that the settings are volatile and
04378  * should be removed if still present on a reboot.
04379  */
04380 #define JOY_US_VOLATILE             0x00000008L
04381 
04382 #ifdef __cplusplus
04383 };
04384 #endif
04385 
04386 #endif  /* __VJOYDX_INCLUDED__ */
04387 
04388 #endif  /* not MMNOJOY */
04389 #endif  /* _INC_MMSYSTEM */
